content: This will be the right place where you can discuss everything related to the Italian Serie A League, with the Italian Cup and Italian Super Cup attachedI open this new prediction thread for Lega Serie A, the old one has now become quite big and OP hasn't been active for almost 3 years, and therefore I believe that one of the best leagues in the world deserves an always updated thread, I hope my attempt will be appreciated by you guysSeason 2023/2024Current champion: Napoli FCFirst matchday:     19-20-21 August 2023Midweek round:     27 September 2023Christmas break:    Not scheduledLast matchday:     25-26 May 2024Stop for the national teams: 10 September, 15 October, 19 November, 24 March 2024Team list: Atalanta Bologna Cagliari Empoli Fiorentina Frosinone Genoa Inter Juventus Lazio Lecce Milan Monza Napoli Roma Salernitana Sassuolo Torino Udinese Verona

Because this is how they responded to an offer coming from there according to I know.    At the same time I'm wondering what Osimhen is thinking about this now. In my opinion he would like to stay in Europe just as Mbappe did the same.Sometimes teams want insane amount from the teams they don't want to send their player to. This must be one of those moments. For example if a top European team make an enquiry for Osimhen I don't think Napoli's response would be the same as the one against Saudi Arabian teams. They would demand a much more reasonable amount.

comments.author: HajiBagi
comments.body: Quote from: Lillominato89 on August 10, 2023, 12:20:15 AMAccording to recent media news, it seems that the negotiation that should bring Romelu Lukaku to Juventus and Dusan Vlahovic to Chelsea is still in a stalemate, in order to deprive Juventus of the strong striker, Juventus are also asking for a balance of 40 million in addition to Lukaku but Chelsea it doesn't go beyond 25 million + Lukaku.I think it will be difficult for this deal to be made at these figures, as it would mean a capital loss for JuventusYeah, I also believe that the deal will not go through because Chelsea are not happy with the offer made in exchange for Lukaku. This Lukaku issue has become very serious because neither Juventus nor any other team are interested in trading for him, and because Chelsea already have a number of young players who are capable of performing well this season, I think that they should sell Lukaku at any cost because they also do not need to have him back on the team. Because of his performance for Inter Milan, I think that if Chelsea needs Lukaku, they won't want to trade him for another player; instead, they'll want to use him as their season's leading striker.I've heard a rumour that Juventus supporters shouted at their stadium yesterday after the team's game that they did not want Romelu Lukaku to join them because he is a traitor. I think Juventus should consider this situation before signing Lukaku to the team because if the supporters of a team dislike a player, there is a problem. In order to be able to sign Lukaku, Juventus should ask their fans and also communicate to them in a reasonable way that would calm them down. If they get Lukaku and the fans do not want him, they will lose a lot of fans.

comments.author: Lillominato89
comments.body: Yesterday Inter officially concluded the deal for Emil Audero who will join the neroazzuri on a temporary basis and with an obligation to buy. While Filip Stankovic will instead take the opposite route and join Sampdoria in Serie B to gain experience, a second sin! Stankovic seemed very promising to me. Now we await the official purchase of Samardzic and then Inter will concentrate their efforts on a striker, Taremi, Arnautovic are on the list but Bologna are asking a lot, and Martial from Manchester UTD.For Juventus it seems that he is working to terminate the contract with his captain Leonardo Bonucci, news that is leaving the Juventus fans speechless.These are the latest transfer market news from Serie A

comments.author: ILuckyGuyI
comments.body: Samardzic and Balogun are also other transfer targets for Inter currently.However I don't know if there is really a big need for a central midfielder right now unless they are about to sell at least one of the current midfielders. Because there are 6 central midfielders in the squad already. They are just making the number too high which can cause big problems about playing time. I hope Inzaghi has a plan about this situation.Balogun would be a really nice replacement for Lukaku. He has been quite productive in the recent times as a young striker. Maybe we can see a similar coherence between him and Martinez to the Lukaku - Martinez duo in the past. But I think this wouldn't be a permanent deal. He would be loaned to Inter by Arsenal.
